newsitem.title: JAPAN: PRESS DIGEST - Top Japan business news - Jan 21.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Top Japan business news - Jan 21.

text.p: Nissan Motor Co Ltd is expected to post a consolidated net profit of around 55 billion yen in the business year to March 31, against a net loss of 88.4 billion yen the year before, thanks to improved earnings at its overseas units in Mexico and Europe. The turnaround is supported mainly by Nissan's Mexican manufacturing subsidiary, which turned profitable in the year ended Decemebr.

Nissan Motor Co Ltd plans to produce 100,000 of its Pulsar models annually in Britain in 2000 to meet growing demand for subcompact cars in Europe. Total investment in the project will be around 10 billion yen. Toyota Motor Corp and Honda Motor Co Ltd also plan to increase vehicle production in Britain.

The total value of corporate bonds floated by Japanese companies on the domestic market increased by 63 percent from a year earlier to 9.43 trillion yen in calendar 1996, the highest level in seven years.
